definitions.definition: To perceive or detect someone or something with the eyes , or as if by sight .

subdefinitions.definition: To witness or observe by personal experience .
examples: Now I've seen it all!
I'm seeing much better since I got my eyeglasses recalibrated.
I have been blind since birth and I love to read Braille. When the books arrive in from the library, I can’t wait to see what stories they have sent me.

subdefinitions.definition: To watch (a movie) at a cinema , or a show on television etc.
examples: I saw the latest Tarantino flick last week.

definitions.definition: To form a mental picture of.

examples: Do you see what I mean?

subdefinitions.definition: To come to a realization of having been mistaken or misled.
examples: They're blind to the damage they do, but someday they'll see .
The oracle saw the destruction of the city.
You see , Johnny, your Dad isn't your real father.
You're not welcome here any more, see ?

subdefinitions.definition: To have an interview with; especially, to make a call upon; to visit.
examples: You'd better see about that with the boss.
I've been seeing her for two months.

subdefinitions.definition: To visit for a medical appointment.
examples: You should see a doctor about that rash on your arm.
I've been seeing a therapist for three years now.

definitions.definition: To be the setting or time of.
examples: The 20th century saw humanity's first space exploration.
1999 saw the release of many great films.

definitions.definition: Chiefly followed by that : to ensure that something happens, especially by personally witnessing it.
examples: I'll see you hang for this
I was the docks seeing that the goods got properly unloaded.
I saw that they didn't make any more trouble.
I saw the old lady safely across the road.
You can see yourself out.

definitions.definition: To respond to another player's bet with a bet of equal value.
examples: I'll see your twenty dollars and raise you ten.

definitions.definition: To determine by trial or experiment ; to find out ( if or whether ).
examples: I'll come over later and see if I can fix your computer.
You think I can't beat you in a race, eh? We'll see .
Look to see if these jeans still fit you.

definitions.definition: To reference or to study for further details .
examples: Step 4: In the system, check out the laptop to the student ( see : "Logging Resources" in the Tutor Manual ).
Tutor Manual
For a complete proof of the Poincaré conjecture, see Appendix C.

definitions.definition: To examine something closely, or to utilize something, often as a temporary alternative.
examples: Can I see that lighter for a second? Mine just quit working.

definitions.definition: To include as one of something's experiences.
examples: The equipment has not seen usage outside of our projects.
I saw military service in Vietnam.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To perceive or detect someone or something with the eyes , or as if by sight .
secondary_definitions: To form a mental picture of.
( ergative ) To be the setting or time of.
( by extension ) Chiefly followed by that : to ensure that something happens, especially by personally witnessing it.
( transitive ) To wait upon ; attend , escort .
( gambling , transitive ) To respond to another player's bet with a bet of equal value.
To determine by trial or experiment ; to find out ( if or whether ).
( used in the imperative ) To reference or to study for further details .
To examine something closely, or to utilize something, often as a temporary alternative.
To include as one of something's experiences.
